name: Apes
meaning: Bees (renamed to Vespa, then Lilium, then to Musca Borealis)

name: Apis
meaning: Bee (obsolete name and renamed to Musca Australis, and then shortened to Musca)

name: Argo Navis
meaning: The Ship Argo (now divided into Carina, Puppis, and Vela)

name: Asselli and Praesepe
meaning: Dionysus's Asses (Asellus Borealis and Asellus Australis) and Manger (Beehive Cluster)

name: Asterion and Chara
meaning: Northern and Southern Dogs in Canes Venatici

name: Capra and Haedi
meaning: Goat Amalthea (stars surrounding Capella) and the Kids (Haedus I and Haedus II)

name: Corona Firmiana
meaning: Corona Borealis renamed to honor Count Leopold Anton von Firmian

name: Gladii Electorales Saxonici
meaning: Crossed Swords of the Electorate of Saxony

name: Leo Palatinus
meaning: Lion to honor the Elector Palatine Charles Theodore and his wife Elisabeth Auguste

name: Lochium Funis
meaning: Log line (renamed to Linea Nautica in 1888 by Eliza A. Bowen[16])

name: Linum Piscium
meaning: The line connecting the fish (renamed from Linum Austrinum and Linum Boreum by Bode in 1801; known as Lineola too)

name: Nubecula Major and Nubecula Minor[citation needed]
Piscis Notus
meaning: Southern Fish (obsolete name for Piscis Austrinus)

name: Psalterium Georgii
meaning: George's Psaltery (renamed to Harp Georgii by Lalande)

name: Telescopium Herschelii
meaning: Herschel's Telescope (renamed from Tubus Herschelii Major by Bode in 1801)

name: Turdus Solitarius
meaning: Solitary Thrush (renamed to Mocking Bird and then to Noctua). Named in honor of the Rodrigues solitaire, an extinct flightless bird related to the dodo.

name: Vespa
meaning: Wasp (an obsolete name for Musca Borealis)

name: Triangula, Triangulum, Catuli, Corona, Corolla, Piscis, Camelus, Vulpes, Equus, Delphin, Ursa Minor, Canis, Felis, Leaena and Cervus
meaning: Obsolete names for Triangulum Boreale, Triangulum Australe, Canes Venatici, Corona Borealis, Corona Australis, Piscis Australis, Cameleopardalis, Vulpecula et Anser, Equuleus, Delphinus, Ursa Major, Ursa Minor, Canis Major, Canis Minor, Leo Minor and Monoceros
